context: The word 'paku' is the imperative form of the Estonian verb 'pakuma', which means to offer, propose, or present. It's used when giving a direct command to someone to offer something, such as in 'Pake mulle oma telefon!' meaning 'Offer me your phone!'. The verb belongs to the -ma class of Estonian verbs and can be conjugated into different tenses and forms including past tense (pakusin), present tense (paku/pakub), future tense (pakan/pakad), etc.
